text: Our panel with @PhilippSeu and @akaka15 and others on utopian and dystopian infrastructures got rejected for #ica21 #academictwitter - it took some time but this year I’m only seeing rejections in my timeline; is there anyone in my circles who did get in??

I didn't apply to #ica21 this year, so I have nothing to share. But I had a lot of rejections in the past. It's actually one of the first conferences I ever applied for as a grad students and that time they lost my paper so I didn't even get a review, which sort of hurts 😅

✍️I hope to contribute my bit to normalising rejections in academia by sharing that this week I got two: (1) a panel submitted to #ica21 & (2)a book proposal! I'm still positive about both and actually received v useful/supportive reviews. Hopefully, they will find a home soon 🤓 https://t.co/msdsAdaEhM

Even though #ica21 will be virtual this year, I'm reminded of the special community that comprises all of @icahdq (and especially @ICA_CSaB). I'm thankful to this community which is such a bright light in an otherwise dark time. ♥️ (fin)

Register for #ica21. If you aren't already an @ICA_CSaB member, join our vibrant community! If you are already a member, make sure you are on our Slack. If you run a lab, make sure your lab is featured on our website https://t.co/8BE1LUsEIQ. DM @shitPrateekSays to get added (7/n)

And finally, a BIG thank YOU to @allison_eden who planned the #ica21 conference for @ICA_CSaB. As Vice Chair, I've had a sneak peak and the schedule and let me tell you, @ICA_CSaB has an incredible lineup this year (6/n)

The short turnaround between #ica21 submission and feedback (@icahdq is the fastest conference I submit to) coupled with the helpful reviews, means that I am able to directly and immediately apply referee feedback to my ongoing research projects. What an AWESOME benefit! (5/n)

I'm also thankful for the @icahdq leadership. #ica21 reviews were due 6 Nov. In less than 10 weeks, submissions were evaluated, the conference was planned, and scores were returned to submitters. This is faster than many journals! (4/n)

I'm particularly thankful for these #ica21 reviews given that referees returned their evaluations quickly, during a remarkably difficult time, and that the @ICA_CSaB community came together for to provide careful and detailed feedback. Our community honors its commitments! (3/n)

First, THANK YOU to everyone who completed #ica21 reviews for @ICA_CSaB. I say this yearly, but reviews in our interest group are among the best at @icahdq. The reviews (especially the critical ones) were thoughtful and provided helpful feedback that I can immediately apply (2/n)
By now, all #ica21 submitters have received their reviews (https://t.co/B8uS8Gh6sc). In this short thread, I'd like to express some gratitude (1/n)

To all who found the bandwidth to review, thank you 🙏🏼.

To all who practiced self-care and said no to submitting or reviewing, respect 🧡.
